summary: multiple studies have confirmed the presence of human bocavirus1 (HBoV1) in respiratory tract samples of children. the viral load, presentation of single detection and its role as a causative agent of severe respiratory tract infections have not been thoroughly elucidated. 10/18 (55.6%) patients belonged to the HBoV1 high viral load group. 7/10 (70%) patients had cases of HBoV1 single detection. electronic supplementary material available to authorized users.
